title: Baulne-en-Brie
text:
Baulne-en-Brie is a former <a href="Communes%20of%20France">commune</a> in the <a href="Departments%20of%20France">department</a> of <a href="Aisne">Aisne</a> in northern <a href="France">France</a>. On 1 January 2016, it was merged into the new commune <a href="Vall%C3%A9es-en-Champagne">Vallées-en-Champagne</a>, of which it is a <a href="Communes%20of%20France">delegated commune</a>.
Geography.
Baulne-en-Brie is located some 15 km east by south-east of <a href="Ch%C3%A2teau-Thierry">Château-Thierry</a> and 20 km west by south-west of <a href="%C3%89pernay">Épernay</a>. It can be accessed by the D4 road from <a href="Cond%C3%A9-en-Brie">Condé-en-Brie</a> in the west through the heart of the commune and the village and continuing east to <a href="Breuil%2C%20Marne">Le Breuil</a>. There is also a country road from <a href="La%20Chapelle-Monthodon">La Chapelle-Monthodon</a> in the north. The south-eastern border of the commune is part of the border between the departments of <a href="Aisne">Aisne</a> and <a href="Marne%20%28department%29">Marne</a>. There are three hamlets in the commune other than the village: Montchevret, Grande Fontaine, and Romandie. There are extensive forests in the north, centre, south-east and south of the commune with the rest of the area being farmland.
The "Verdonnelle" stream flows north-west through the southern part of the commune passing near the hamlet of Romandie and continuing north-west out of the commune. The "Surmelin" stream flows from the south-east passing through the village and continuing north-west to join the <a href="Marne%20%28river%29">Marne</a> near <a href="M%C3%A9zy-Moulins">Mézy-Moulins</a>.
Administration.
List of Successive Mayors of Baulne-en-Brie
Demography.
In 2012 the commune had 262 inhabitants.
Economy.
Baulne-en-Brie is an agricultural and wine-producing village and a part of the <a href="Appellation%20d%27origine%20contr%C3%B4l%C3%A9e">Appellation d'origine contrôlée</a> (AOC) zone for "Champagne of Aisne".
